6. In order to trigger or turn- ON a SCR, the potential difference between anode-to-cathode must be:

explanations.a: Explanation 1: SCR turns-ON or goes into forward conduction mode when a positive voltage is applied between the anode and cathode together with positive gate current.

questions.question: 7. Which of the following statements differentiate the SCR from a diode?

answers.a: It blocks current when reverse biased.
answers.b: It conducts when forward biased at a given gate signal.
answers.c: It conducts when forward biased without any gate signal.
answers.d: It conducts when reverse biased at a given gate signal.

explanations.b: Explanation 2: A diode conducts when the voltage between the anode and cathode is positive (forward biased). For a SCR to conduct, in addition to positive anode-to-cathode voltage, a sufficient gate current  is also necessary.

questions.question: 11. Which of the following statements is correct?
